newsitem.title: FRANCE: France urges Turkey to cling to democracy.
newsitem.headline: France urges Turkey to cling to democracy.

text.p: French Prime Minister Alain Juppe urged Turkey on Saturday to stick to democracy in order to draw closer to Europe.
"We hope Turkey will pursue its path towards Europe because it has a place in the European family," Juppe told reporters.
He said this meant Ankara should continue building on its democracy "as we have always hoped throughout the long negotiations between the European Union and Turkey."
He was speaking after a meeting of leaders of the European Democratic Union, an umbrella group of 40 European centre-right political parties.

In Ankara, a military-dominated council delivered a similar message, telling Turkey's Islamist-led government not to stray from the path of democracy and official secularism after weeks of tension between secularist generals and the ruling coalition.
Strains escalated after the army sent tanks on manoeuvres through Ankara's Sincan district early in February after an Islamist protest there attended by the Iranian ambassador.
Rumours of a possible coup have been rife but Western diplomats say the generals are reluctant to intervene, partly because Turkey's image abroad would suffer.
